alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 15 at 2:11AM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM MST TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY STRONG TO DAMAGING WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A fast moving but very dynamic storm system and associated cold front will pass from west to east over New Mexico today. Peak wind speeds in excess of 60 mph are likely over northeast and east central New Mexico from late this morning through much of the afternoon and will be combined with low humidities and above normal temperatures. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and East Central Plains from midday today to around sunset. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 30 to 50 mph with gusts to around 60 mph or greater. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
